subject: Private and Sectarian Schools
Football
Education and Schools
lead_paragraph: New Jersey’s public and private high schools will not be split into separate sports leagues. In a close vote, members of the New Jersey Interscholastic Athletic Association rejected a plan to separate the schools for football only and a second plan that would have split up the schools for all sports. The proposal to separate all sports failed by eight votes. The vote to separate only football failed by a wider margin.Critics say private schools have an advantage because they are not limited by attendance boundaries. But smaller public schools say they would have been forced to travel farther if the system were changed.
